2019-06-23T14:56:11Z: And so, that's that. Just one week until the next GP in Austria, and we'll see you there for all the action as it unfolds! Here's the report, and we'll bid you au revoir! French GP: Hamilton takes emphatic win, Bottas resists LeclercFormula 1 championship leader Lewis Hamilton absolutely dominated the French Grand Prix, leading every lap from pole position to extend his lead in the championship to 36 points
2019-06-23T14:54:10Z: The national anthems, like they were in Monaco, were being played by a live band. Assuming it's the same band, they've not had to learn anything new...
2019-06-23T14:53:10Z: The giant red gorilla stands atop the podium. We're not sure of it's significance, the south of France is seldom known for its large simian population...
2019-06-23T14:51:20Z: The top three are greeted by Sir Jackie Stewart, who celebrated his 80th birthday a couple of weeks ago. He doesn't look it at all, rather he looks more than ready to jump into any of the cars today...tartan trousers and all.
2019-06-23T14:43:59Z: Hamilton seemed to have that all under control. Leclerc gave Bottas a real run for his money - for the love of F1, it would be lovely if we could have a proper two-team fight. Maybe even three - is that asking for too much?
2019-06-23T14:42:46Z: Stewards are investigating Ricciardo after that, leaving the circuit and gaining an advantage.
2019-06-23T14:42:11Z: A big skirmish for seventh, as Ricciardo goes off-track twice to recover the position from Norris, then Raikkonen.
2019-06-23T14:41:29Z: Sainz was the final driver to finish on the lead lap, while Ricciardo, Raikkonen, Hulkenberg and an unfortunate Norris complete the points.
2019-06-23T14:40:38Z: Hamilton set a 1m32.764s on the final lap to snatch fastest lap, only for Vettel - who was fifth over the line - to pinch it by 0.024s!
2019-06-23T14:39:54Z: Leclerc had a look at Bottas into the final corner but Mercedes seals a one-two, with Verstappen fourth over the line.
2019-06-23T14:39:09Z: Some way up the road, Hamilton crosses the line and wins the French Grand Prix!
2019-06-23T14:39:08Z: Norris couldn't hold on, and he's tumbled behind Ricciardo, Raikkonen and Hulkenberg. A great shame after a stellar drive to hang onto that.
2019-06-23T14:38:47Z: Leclerc isn't close enough to have a look into the chicane, or into Signes - so second should be Bottas's.
2019-06-23T14:37:43Z: Hamilton starts the final lap with 17s in hand over Bottas, who is only four tenths ahead of Leclerc!
2019-06-23T14:37:30Z: Norris has managed to keep Ricciardo at bay through this lap, somehow - just one more to go.
2019-06-23T14:36:50Z: Vettel pits for a set of softs, no doubt with the hope of bagging a bonus point for the fastest lap.
2019-06-23T14:36:17Z: Ricciardo's right on the back of Norris now - Norris still has hydraulics problems, and Ricciardo smells blood.
2019-06-23T14:36:05Z: The fight for second does look tasty all of a sudden. Leclerc is 1.6s behind Bottas.
2019-06-23T14:35:32Z: Verstappen says his tyres are pretty funfed. He has 3.3s in hand over Vettel.
2019-06-23T14:34:28Z: That's the VSC over. Quoth Liam Gallagher, as you were...
2019-06-23T14:34:07Z: There's a bollard rolling along the track. Now THERE'S excitement...VSC as the marshal retrieves it.
2019-06-23T14:32:44Z: Norris looks like he's weathered the storm so far, opening the gap to Ricciardo by two seconds with his unwell McLaren.
2019-06-23T14:32:32Z: Hamilton is told to be wary of the car ahead, as he comes up to lap Norris's McLaren.
2019-06-23T14:31:45Z: Kvyat's cruised past Albon this time, bagging P14.
2019-06-23T14:30:15Z: There's a lot less drama at the front of the field. Hamilton is 15s clear of Bottas, whose just had a pretty scruffy lap. Leclerc's too far back to give him too much to worry about, though.
2019-06-23T14:29:13Z: Grosjean's been asked to pull in and retire. Certainly not the kind of home race any driver dreams of.
2019-06-23T14:26:28Z: The Toro Rossos are having a fight for 14th place, Kvyat all over Albon with the faster medium tyre. The Russian tries a move around the outside of Signes, but Albon holds the line.
2019-06-23T14:24:50Z: Ferrari, perhaps jokingly, tells Vettel he's now on plan F, and that he should keep his head down and keep pushing. Anything to keep us entertained.
2019-06-23T14:20:34Z: That effort is a new lap record, too. Or was, anyway, until Hamilton shaved another four thousandths off on lap 42.
2019-06-23T14:20:04Z: Ha - Hamilton, on tyres he reports have blisters, immediately snatches back fastest lap with a 1m33.724s.
2019-06-23T14:19:24Z: Ooooh. There's a new fastest lap - but it's not from either of the Mercedes. Leclerc sets a 1m33.828s.
2019-06-23T14:18:57Z: Stroll finally pits after 40 laps and rejoins 13th, elevating Hulkenberg into the points.
2019-06-23T14:16:34Z: The Racing Point mechanics looked ready to go out into the pits, but Stroll remains on-track for another lap.
2019-06-23T14:14:12Z: Vettel's challenge has definitely faltered. He's 7.5s behind Verstappen and going nowhere fast.
2019-06-23T14:13:08Z: Only Stroll is yet to pit now, he's going long like he did in Canada. However, with the gaps as they are, it'll be a big ask for him to get points again.
2019-06-23T14:11:01Z: Hulkenberg pits for mediums, but can't rejoin ahead of Raikkonen! He's cleared Gasly, but remains behind the Alfa Romeo driver.
2019-06-23T14:09:40Z: Hamilton says the hard doesn't feel as good as the medium. There had to be something to complain about, didn't there?
2019-06-23T14:08:38Z: Lead gaps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +11.9s; 3 Leclerc +18s; 4 Verstappen +24.6s; 5 Vettel +31s.
2019-06-23T14:07:53Z: Kvyat's now into the pits, grabbing a set of medium tyres for the final 20 laps.
2019-06-23T14:06:34Z: Ricciardo passes former team-mate Kvyat to surge into P10. Norris is another five seconds up the road.
2019-06-23T14:05:38Z: Raikkonen's in from sixth, and presumably Hulkenberg was asked to do the opposite as the Renault mechanics were ready. Hulk's on a push-lap before he comes in for medium tyres.
2019-06-23T14:04:29Z: Almost ironic that Giovinazzi's race number is 99, as it's been a bit of a flaky day for the Italian. Albon's already ditched him and pulled out a two-second gap.
2019-06-23T14:03:16Z: Anything Bottas can do, Hamilton can do better (today, at least). The race leader takes back fastest lap with a 1m34.026s.
2019-06-23T14:02:04Z: Vettel lost ground to Verstappen on his first few laps out of the pits, but sets a personal best on his most recent lap and is now back within six seconds of the Red Bull.
2019-06-23T14:01:53Z: Giovinazzi had passed Albon when the Thai driver left the pits, but Albon's all over him once again - diving down the inside at Signes to reclaim 16th place.
2019-06-23T14:00:30Z: Grosjean's now easy pickings for Gasly. Gunther Steiner looks very stern on the pitwall, presumably thinking of a choice phrase to continue his Netflix stardom...
2019-06-23T14:00:00Z: Bottas responds on lap 29, setting a 1m34.250s to move 4s clear of Leclerc.
2019-06-23T13:58:33Z: Hamilton's lead is the best part of 12s as he sets another fastest lap. Bottas's margin over Leclerc is a less comfortable 3.6s.
2019-06-23T13:56:31Z: How many times are we going to write this again this afternoon? It's another new fastest lap for Hamilton, who sets a 1m34.581s.
2019-06-23T13:56:12Z: Albon's in from ninth place, coming out fractions ahead of Giovinazzi.
2019-06-23T13:55:39Z: We're halfway through the race. Hasn't it gone quickly.
2019-06-23T13:54:56Z: The overcut didn't work for Ferrari. Vettel is in and out swiftly enough, but rejoins 4s behind Verstappen.
2019-06-23T13:54:09Z: Vettel locks up his front-left tyre into Turn 1 and asks to pit. Ferrari OKs the decision.
2019-06-23T13:53:24Z: Stroll and Albon are still yet to come in, as are Kvyat, Grosjean, Russell and Kubica.
2019-06-23T13:52:54Z: Giovinazzi starting on softs looks to be the wrong call, and depending on gaps should fall behind Raikkonen and Hulkenberg once they stop.
2019-06-23T13:52:43Z: Hamilton gets the call to pit, and heads in now to move onto the hard tyre.
2019-06-23T13:52:09Z: Bottas rejoins 4.4s clear of Leclerc, who is 6.5s ahead of Verstappen.
2019-06-23T13:51:14Z: Bottas pits for a set of hards, dropping behind the yet-to-stop Vettel into third.
2019-06-23T13:50:47Z: Hamilton reports his tyres still feel good. To prove it, he sets another new fastest lap - this time it's a 1m34.683s.
2019-06-23T13:48:40Z: Leclerc pits next time by at the end of lap 22, and also swaps his mediums for a set of hards.
2019-06-23T13:48:12Z: Raikkonen and Hulkenberg now head the midpack in sixth and seventh - Hulkenberg's been hustling the Finn all the way so far, but hasn't been able to find a way past.
2019-06-23T13:47:29Z: Verstappen is the first of the leaders to pit, and switches to hard tyres.
2019-06-23T13:46:29Z: Mercedes tells Bottas it thinks the Ferraris are starting to struggle with their front tyres.
2019-06-23T13:46:09Z: Sainz also comes in for hard tyres, and reappears ahead of Kvyat and Norris.
2019-06-23T13:45:06Z: Not a particularly well-timed pitstop for Norris, who comes out of the pits between Kvyat and Grosjean.
2019-06-23T13:44:31Z: Leading gaps after 20 laps: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +5.4s; 3 Leclerc +11.6s; 4 Verstappen +17.4s; 5 Vettel +20.7s.
2019-06-23T13:44:04Z: But Ricciardo gets a brilliant run on the Mistral straight, forcing Gasly to one side of the track before blasting past into the chicane.
2019-06-23T13:43:08Z: Gasly's now in, responding to Ricciardo. It's enough to stay ahead - a slow-ish stop for Ricciardo has played into the Frenchman's hands.
2019-06-23T13:41:18Z: Ricciardo comes in to fit the hard tyres, hoping to clear Gasly with the undercut. Magnussen's also in, having cried enough with the ailing mediums.
2019-06-23T13:40:14Z: Norris is very close to Sainz now, as Gasly continues to hold off Ricciardo for eighth.
2019-06-23T13:39:44Z: Vettel has taken bigger chunks out of Verstappen's advantage over the past few laps, and is 5.2s behind the Red Bull now.
2019-06-23T13:39:21Z: Albon's taken 14th from Magnussen, a really close-fought battle at the Mistral chicane. Kvyat subsequently passes him at Signes on the following lap, with consummate ease.
2019-06-23T13:37:50Z: Yet another fastest lap for Hamilton - who's complained that something is broken in his seat. It doesn't seem to be affecting him too much as he sets a 1m34.803s.
2019-06-23T13:36:20Z: The five leaders are pretty spread out right now. Hamilton - who's just set another new fastest lap - is 2.7s clear of Bottas, who now has five seconds in hand over Leclerc. Verstappen is 3s further back, with Vettel 6.3s behind him.
2019-06-23T13:35:39Z: Ricciardo's now all over Gasly, who seems to be struggling with the soft tyres now.
2019-06-23T13:35:06Z: On the Perez penalty: in F3 yesterday, Juri Vips was granted a five-second penalty, and then it was rescinded later on after review. Given Perez didn't really do a whole lot wrong there, we wonder if it's open to the same interpretation...
2019-06-23T13:34:09Z: Stroll clears Magnussen, who now seems easy pickings for the Toro Rosso boys.
2019-06-23T13:32:20Z: Bottas sets fastest lap now - it's a 1m35.448s for the second-place man.
2019-06-23T13:31:52Z: Vettel is only taking a couple of tenths a lap out of Verstappen at the moment, but there's still 7.5s between them.
2019-06-23T13:31:07Z: Norris, having been gazumped by his team-mate at the start, is closing in Sainz. Carlos' tyres are also showing Sainz of graining, and is now six seconds behind Vettel.
2019-06-23T13:29:41Z: Perez gets a five-second penalty for leaving the track and gaining an advantage. Given he's gone through the bollard, that's quite curious...
2019-06-23T13:28:46Z: Hamilton does two more fastest laps in succession. His latest effort is a 1m35.741s, which puts him 2.6s clear of Bottas.
2019-06-23T13:28:03Z: Kvyat's cleared Grosjean, blasting past on the Mistral straight with DRS. Albon's next up, who's stuck behind Stroll.
2019-06-23T13:27:02Z: Hard tyres for Giovinazzi, which sends him all the way to the rear of the pack.
2019-06-23T13:27:00Z: Verstappen giving Leclerc a run for his money at the start
2019-06-23T13:26:10Z: Giovinazzi falls further down the order, dropping behind Hulkenberg. He pits at the end of lap 7.
2019-06-23T13:25:23Z: Vettel gets Sainz into the chicane, two laps after passing the Spaniard's McLaren team-mate at the same spot.
2019-06-23T13:24:26Z: Ricciardo finally bags ninth from Giovinazzi, the Alfa Romeo driver tries to cover the inside of the chicane, but the Australian grabs the place with ease. Raikkonen has also passed his team-mate, as the soft tyres begin to wane.
2019-06-23T13:23:28Z: Another new fastest lap of the race from Hamilton - this time it's a 1m35.945s.
2019-06-23T13:23:10Z: Replays show Vettel getting an almighty DRS-assisted draft past Norris on the run to the chicane.
2019-06-23T13:22:27Z: The TV shots are busy showing replays of the start, but Vettel has passed Norris for sixth. Norris has a think about retaliating at Signes, but the position is the Ferrari's.
2019-06-23T13:22:08Z: Ricciardo had a great initial getaway at the start, bombing into the top few, but gets hung out to dry into turn 2, falling behind Gasly and Giovinazzi.
2019-06-23T13:20:22Z: Kvyat watch: he's cleared both of the Williamses, and Grosjean's next up for the Toro Rosso driver.
2019-06-23T13:19:39Z: Hamilton sets the fastest lap of the race - a 1m36.751s.
2019-06-23T13:19:07Z: Ricciardo has half a look at Giovinazzi into the Mistral chicane, but it's just not happening there.
2019-06-23T13:18:42Z: Hamilton's lead is 1.4s at the end of the second lap. Leclerc is another 1.1s back in third, while Verstappen has shaken off Sainz and is 3.4s clear of the McLaren.
2019-06-23T13:17:39Z: No progress from Vettel at the start of the race - he's still seventh, around half a second behind Norris.
2019-06-23T13:17:13Z: Order at the end of the first lap: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Leclerc; 4 Verstappen; 5 Sainz; 6 Norris; 7 Vettel; 8 Gasly; 9 Giovinazzi; 10 Ricciardo
2019-06-23T13:16:38Z: Albon and Grosjean are the other losers on lap 1 - the Toro Rosso driver has dropped to P16, and Grosjean's fallen behind Stroll and Kubica.
2019-06-23T13:16:28Z: Verstappen gave Leclerc a run for his money through the opening corners but quickly found himself under pressure from one of the McLarens - it's Sainz who leads that charge right now.
2019-06-23T13:15:28Z: Ricciardo's slipped back behind Gasly and Giovinazzi there, dropping to P10 in the early stages.
2019-06-23T13:15:08Z: Hamilton gets a good getaway and holds his lead into the first corner, as Leclerc, Verstappen and Norris squabble for third.
2019-06-23T13:14:19Z: Lights out - the French Grand Prix is underway!
2019-06-23T13:13:16Z: The cars wind around the final corners, ready to slide into their grid slots.
2019-06-23T13:13:11Z: Speaking of tyres - here's what everyone is starting on:Hamilton - mediumBottas - mediumLeclerc - mediumVerstappen - mediumNorris - mediumSainz - mediumVettel - mediumRicciardo - mediumGasly - softGiovinazzi - softAlbon - mediumRaikkonen - hardHulkenberg - hardPerez - mediumMagnussen - mediumGrosjean - hardStroll - hardKubica - mediumKvyat - hardRussell  - medium
2019-06-23T13:11:38Z: We're off for the formation lap! Time to get some heat into those tyres...but not too much, as track temps approach 55C.
2019-06-23T13:09:55Z: Tyre blankets are now being peeled off, ready for the formation lap...
2019-06-23T13:08:13Z: There's going to be 53 laps of this circuit, but last year Gasly and Ocon didn't even make it one as they collided at turn 1. Everyone's going to have to avoid going for an early bath today...although with the temperatures, they might be tempted!
2019-06-23T13:05:22Z: So let's review the weekend so far. Bottas topped two practice sessions, Hamilton topped FP1 and quali, and they're both on the front row. Everyone in the top 8 is on the mediums, as we expect heavy tyre wear here - the tyres are melting in the sun like a hot camembert cheese.
2019-06-23T13:01:22Z: Hello and welcome to the Autosport Live coverage of the French Grand Prix! It's a sunny ol' day in Le Castellet, I'm a poet and I didn't know it, and we'll get going in just ten minutes' time.
